meanings.definition: Attempt to repair or improve something in a casual or desultory way.
meanings.sent1: I like to tinker with broken toys to see if I can fix them.
meanings.sent2: He often tinkers with his bicycle to make it run smoother.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat decided to tinker with the clock, causing it to chime at odd hours.
meanings.sent4: Her mind would tinker with the idea of starting a new hobby.
meanings.sent5: As the sun set, he would tinker with the old radio, trying to bring it back to life.

meanings.definition: A person who travels from place to place mending metal utensils.
meanings.sent1: The tinker came to our village to fix our pots and pans.
meanings.sent2: In the olden days, a tinker was a valuable member of the community.
meanings.sent3: The tinker's cart clinked with the sound of metal tools as he moved along.
meanings.sent4: She thought of the tinker as a magical metal whisperer.
meanings.sent5: Children would gather around the tinker, fascinated by his craft.
